subject: Re: JUnit-JPA (Hibernate) - Spring - Struts2 testing howto
msgSnippet: Hello, thanks a lot, Joakim. I found a solution for this, but your post helped me a lot to understand better how it works. Unfortenately, now I cannot find any
messageBody:
Hello,
thanks a lot, Joakim. I found a solution for this, but your post
helped me a lot to understand better how it works.

Unfortenately, now I cannot find any example to test Struts2 with
service (from Spring) injected. Actually I made something to work with
real service, but this is not unit test, but integration.

Does anybody know how to Mock some service which I inject into Struts2
action, even better how to mock value some service returns? That is
the question!

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Joakim Ohlrogge" <joakim.ohlrogge@...>
wrote:
>
> Try this:
> Right-click on the project in eclipse.
> Choose properties
> Choose java buildpath
> Choose libraries
> * add any jars that you need there. If you are using maven I
find it
> helpful to add the jars using "add variable", Configure a variable
called
> MAVEN_REPO (or whatever you fancy). As soon as you have that
variable you
> can click on it and press the extend... button and browse to the
library you
> want relative to the variable. This is very nice to have in a multi
> developer situation since the mvn-repo may be in different locations
for
> different developers and all each developer needs to do is to
configure
> their own MAVEN_REPO variable.
>
> Finally, go to the tab "order and export". In this tab you can
change the
> order of your Classpath. Make sure that the JPA-api is suficiently
high in
> that list. That should do it.
>
> The above should resolve the issue (you might need to remove your
launches
> for your new settings to be propagated there)
>
> But it should also do the trick just to change which JRE you launch
with
> (either configure it globally or locally in the project-properties).
Did you
> try that?
>
> I hope this helps, hunting classpath-issues can really be
frustrating. My
> sympathies.
> /J
>
